Reviews.Content: the moment i received the camera.. i was so excited and read the manual immediately... afterwards, i submerged into a bowl of water. Impressive! I even tried to take snapshots  while it's submerged. It works really well. It's worth the money i spent.Good job Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Great little tough camera
Reviews.Author: Drae
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Hawaii, we wanted a camera to take underwater photos when we snorkeled (my first time snorkeling). It was easy & fun to use. And it works great for "regular" use, too.

Reviews.Title: Intermittent problems
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Thiboutot
Reviews.Content: It's really a shame because I love this camera WHEN IT WORKS.  Unfortunately it has failed me on more than one vacation.  It has crapped out on me in hot, humid weather (like you'd find in the Caribbean)... and I've had leakage problems.  It's very frustrating to have your camera die when you want it most, only to miraculously recover as soon as we got home!

Reviews.Title: Didn't last long
Reviews.Author: sheltie lover
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take on a cruise 2 years ago.It worked well for about 18 months then started having problems  I thought it just needed new batteries,  the camera will turn on and then just shut off. It would say it had full battery then no battery.After several new batteries that didn't fix the problem, I give up. Expensive camera that did not last long. Neighbor had similar camera will same issue.

Reviews.Title: Good for adventure but not for everyday use
Reviews.Author: E. Olivier "Professional reader"
Reviews.Content: I've had the Olympus Stylus Tough8000 a few years, now, and it is my go-to camera for all big adventures. It's great with bright-light outdoor shots as well as underwater pictures. It holds up to sand and sea, to tumbling down mountainsides, to beating eaten by teething children. As long as there's strong light, my pictures have been excellent.In addition, the tap feature is helpful on snowy days when I don't want to take my mittens off; it's saved my fingers from additional discomfort a number of times.The problem comes when the light fades or I'm indoors; then the pictures become grainy and dark. The flash is overly bright, illuminating only what's right there in front of me and blacking out everything in the background. Using some of the scene settings (like the one with city lights behind the two little girls or the candlelight dinner one) helps but doesn't fix the problem. The food scene setting is useless which is sad since I take a lot of food pictures.I've loaned my camera out to a few people going on tropical vacations and they've been mostly pleased with their daytime shots, especially the underwater ones, but they all switched to their camera phones for the nighttime or indoors pictures.To sum up: If you're going to be taking pictures in the sun or while running around on a snowy day or diving underwater, this camera will give you excellent results. As an everyday, all-around camera, though, you'll probably be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Heard It Works Well
Reviews.Author: KrisCord
Reviews.Content: I got this item as a gift for someone that seems to like to drop and break most of their electronics.  So far so good.  It seems like it's still working well.  I don't know how much abuse it has gotten though, or if it's been under water.

Reviews.Title: useless waterproof cam !
Reviews.Author: alexander
Reviews.Content: water intrusion under 1 meter / 3 feet ! useless waterproof function i had to ship it back for exchange ,Exchange done but they could upgrade me for 8010 !!

Reviews.Title: Severe dissappointment
Reviews.Author: Jim Schwartz
Reviews.Content: "Tough" is truly a misnomer here!  Without even being banged around my camera leaked.  Then, it was replaced with one that must have been a refurbished unit.  UGH

Reviews.Title: cold, drop, wet, but NEVER hot!
Reviews.Author: John E. Eyberg "John Eyberg a.k.a. Juanito Ha...
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Stylus Tough 8000 2 years ago after seeing the TV ad showing tremendous abuse in expectation that it would be abused mightily during my "Dry'd, Fry'd, & Sky'd by Headwinds & Heat: My 1300mile/2100kilometer Trans-Texas Bicycle Odyssey" 11JUN-08JUL2011. And it was; in fact it has held up admirably ever since, which included travel to l'anse aux meadows, New Foundland, Canada, and several other bicycle tours. This product has been great--until recently; heat from the Sun seems to be causing internal problems, i.e., it won't shut down upon command, won't retrieve upon command, won't follow anything upon command until it cools off. I guess I shouldn't complain--I've given it a huge amount of wear & tear, with nearly everyday use via Twitter. Would I recommend this camera to you? Yes, unless you are more of a professional. It is infinitely better than 35mm SLR, which I used for years. Now I have thousands of slides and am going to go through the onerous process of converting them to digital...!

Reviews.Title: It still works. And works well.
Reviews.Author: Cable 900
Reviews.Content: I needed a nearly indestructible digital camera, and finally found one. And It still works. I previously shot only with film, using disposable waterproof cameras for our extreme sports. Once I got the white-balance figured out, I was able to take good shots and video, in quickly changing conditions.The software and hardware image stabilization helps my friends take good photos too. It has a good microphone for recording sound for video but a really weak playback. I only heard all the boat chatter when I viewed the video on my laptop. Dubbed the "Hurt Cam," its first use of shooting wakeboarding pics and vids broke everyone in the boat (ie "Go Big or Go Home") in 45 minutes. But it survived.

Reviews.Title: Great "utility" camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Barbrie
Reviews.Content: Handle and clean properly and it will last.5 stars for building a waterproof cam....very durable for harsh environments.3 stars for optics. wish the pics were sharper; (better late than never review)Used on open 30ft. charter boat; worked great in a saltwater environment.After 3+ years, still works great at the beach, in the pool, or on the boat.

Reviews.Title: Rough but required!
Reviews.Author: BRIAN TYLER
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my water-based honeymoon and have been very pleased with it.  It's a bit heavy and perhaps now outdated (I haven't kept up with newer products) but it has exceeded my expectations.  It handles drops, throws, misses, plunges, and sand without blinking a lens cap (sorry, I had to).  I always drop it when I hand it to friends just to freak them out, and I've never worried about it holding up.  It's taken a beating around rocks, beaches, salty SCUBA dives, and speed, and shows little wear -- just enough to show that I've been somewhere and give it character.  This was a great alternative to the oddly shaped turquoise competitor and I like how it fits conveniently in a front pocket.  Only complaint is that the picture quality is clearly not as good as my other (dry) point and shoot and it's much heavier, though roughly the same size (which is impressive, given its considerable protections).  My other PAS is the same brand as the turquoise one I referenced, and has great quality images.  Still, this gets shots in places I never could have dreamed, and protects them until I get home.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Big Olympus fan.
Reviews.Author: E. Held
Reviews.Content: Like the first one I bought so I had to get the new one. This camera seems even tougher than my old one. Definitily worth the money. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but with some faults
Reviews.Author: Fadl Slim
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for more than 2 years now. Here's what I've got to say about it.Pros.Hardy enough to survive all types of misuses a normal camera might be subjected to.Waterproofing actually works.Shoots great photos in auto mode.Underwater photos are Exceptionally good.Shooting panoramic is sweet.Battery life on a full charge is above average.Cons.Scenery mode doesn't always work.Photos shot with Indoor and night Scn. are horrible.The camera is a little heavy.

Reviews.Title: This camera WILL develop a leak just outside of warranty period...
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!!This is the third "waterproof" Olympus I tried and once again it started leaking after a few months' use. And to have it repaired, costs nearly as much as a new camera...!Fortunately other manufacturers now have waterproof cameras too - I will rather try one of theirs before I ever buy an Olympus again.STAY AWAY FROM OLYMPUS WATERPROOF CAMERAS - THEY JUST AREN'T!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not so Tough at all
Reviews.Author: S. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for 2 years so it was just out of the warranty coverage time.  After using it several times during those years, I enjoyed both the good and the bad.  It is light and nice on backpacking trips and has a good amount of megapixels.  The camera does however shoot VERY poorly in low light.  The camera has no idea how to manage these situations.  I still enjoyed this camera despite this fact on my adventures.  The reason I am giving this camera 1 star is its waterproofing.  I used the camera twice in water.  The first time was some fun photos in a swimming hole in New Hampshire.  I recently took the camera to snorkeling (the second time it was in water).  Everything was secure (battery/charger flaps) and I took preliminary shots in the shallows to make sure everything was functioning.  Once I got out 100 yards from shore in water that was 10 feet deep, the camera screen was black despite the blue light being on signifying the camera was on.  I quickly turned the camera off and returned to shore but the time I got there, the camera was finished.  There was water in the battery and charger area and the screen/entire camera was dead.  I feel like I wasted 300 (i bought it when it had just come out) on a camera that didn't deliver what it said it would.  I feel cheated.  I will never but olympus again especially since the olympus warrant doesn't cover water damage despite them claiming the camera is waterproof.  Don't you think a company should back up their water proof claim? (my camera was out of the warranty period but I investigated anyway).  Don't buy.  You are better off with other brand cameras like nikon or canon for your point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Remember where you are...
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Vaught "Mike"
Reviews.Content: ...and recall why you purchased this camera: be it snorkeling on the reefs off the coast of Fiji; taking photos of an incoming habib; or just enjoying the kayaks along the Savannah River with your mates, taking photos of the endangered Spider Lily. This camera be smashing. It takes quick photos and has reasonable picture quality with many scene settings....if it is to have a high quality image point and shoot that will just be used for Christmas frivolities, trips to the orchestra or ballet recitals then I would highly recommend looking for something more like a Canon SD, which will maximize image quality without having the wicked fringe benefits this camera provides of neigh indestructibility.If neigh indestructibility is what you are looking for in your ideal point and shoot, then you are money here. I had to take a star away because it is a touch dated at the time of review and the image quality isn't nearly as sharp as newer point and clickers. (However, I enjoy the over developed circa 1970 film camera look that I sometimes get taking night photos. It has a certain antique charm to it.) But, it does a great job, snaps the photos quick and has little bulk to get in the way of putting it in a cargo pocket, Camelbak pocket or safari jacket pocket and that is something I highly value.

Reviews.Title: Replaces my underwater point and shoot
Reviews.Author: StarZ "Shining Star"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Olympus Stylus SW1030 which, after 3 years, recently flooded when dropped. I have not used this camera fully nor as often as my previous Olympus Stylus SW1030 which I enjoyed immensely, but the Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 MP Digital's features are almost identical. This one has 12 MP in lieu of the 10MP of the previous model, and I think this new one is more rugged. Like my previous Stylus, it was easy to use however, this Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 mp has a card "carrier" where the card is located in the camera. The "itty bitty" card must first be removed from the carrier before inserting into the card reader to download pictures into the computer. I discovered, to my delight, that the card reader I own accepts this tiny one (in a slot on its side) as well as other sizes of camera picture cards.I like the compactness and ease of this little camera. My earlier point-and-shoot made it fun making splash photos in the pool - even without the u/w housing. At deeper depths, I used a camera housing (which I purchased at the same time with my earlier camera). Macro images always came out blurry for me, but it made pretty decent wide angle images- underwater pictures at depths beyond 30'. I hope my previous underwater camera housing (that I purchased with my SW1030) will equally accept this camera. Since the backside looks identical, I suspect it will. At the time of purchase (of my previous camera), at the photography shop, I was told I did not need to use an u/w housing at depths above 30' using the SW1030. In fact, that was true. I took many photos underwater at shallow depths but, in my own experience, I am now going to use the u/w housing to extend the life of the camera, no matter what the depth.The Olympus Stylus SW1030 was an easy-to-operate camera and I know this one will be too, however don't expect picture quality to be as high resolution as the underwater (film camera) Nikonos V or the more sophisticated digital underwater SLRs with u/w housing. My husband used it recently for topside photos and was pleased with the results. The photos were very clear! All in all, this is just what I expected from a simple point-and-shoot style, both above ground and under water.

Reviews.Title: olympus stylus tough 8000
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Silva
Reviews.Content: love the camera..great pictures and it is just about waterproof....I am outdoors in the northeast and needed a small camera with high resolution that am not afraid of damaging in the snow or rain...very shockproof

Reviews.Title: Keeps breaking
Reviews.Author: Gabe Donzelli "Gabe Donzelli"
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera when I first got it.  It had an excellent interface, easy-to-use buttons, and good picture quality.  I could shoot video or take pictures underwater and review my shots without taking my head out of the water.But then it leaked.  While still under warranty, Olympus sent me a brand-new unit.  I worked well for a while, and then it also leaked.  Olympus fixed it.And then it stopped powering on.  Olympus fixed it again (at no charge, even though the warranty had expired) and upgraded the software.  After that, it drained the batteries really fast and, again, stopped powering on.  It is basically an expensive piece of junk right now.  I have to take my old Stylus 770 on my upcoming trip.I am aware that this model is old and that there are new models out there, but I am weary of buying Olympus underwater cameras again.

Reviews.Title: Very good for ppl tough on equipment
Reviews.Author: Daniel C "LuckyAdrenalineJunkie"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first Oly Tough 8000 a little over two years ago, and it's sitting on the desk next to me right now. Still works about as well as I'd expect it to after taking some of the beatings it has.It's been with me snorkeling in the Med, diving in Australia and on dozens of lake and beach trips in several states in the U.S. It's been to the mountains, in the snow, and even on this latest trip to Iraq. It's still ticking.My wife and I are avid SCUBA divers and purchased an Ikelite underwater housing to take video and pictures on dive trips. I've had no problems other than fogging (keep the camera dry before hand, use desiccant packets and this isn't a problem) on our trips to Hawaii, the Bahamas and most recently the Great Barrier Reef.We purchased a second Oly Tough 8000 mostly because we love some of the features and we'll get more longevity out of our underwater housing.I bought both through amazon as well as additional batteries, charger and "floaty wrist strap."Pro:Great to have at the lake with the floaty strap. Tuck it in a pocket, jump in the water and start snapping. I take it out on wakeboard passes and take closeups of others or pictures back towards the boat. Also good for tossing to someone in the water already (again, as long as it has the floaty attached).Really love the high speed shutter for action shots. Pictures aren't DSLR quality, but 3-4 pics per second and 10-15 total is pretty good. You can usually capture a good frame or two.Tap feature isn't bad in the snow, when you don't want to take your gloves offDrop it, smack it on a door frame in your pocket or sit on it... no worries.Con:The older camera, after about two years of abuse, has started to think batteries are dying/dead when switching back and forth between auto mode and any of the special settings. Not quite sure why but it doesn't seem to be the batteries as we'll use them in the newer camera and they're fine.Zoom. 3.6 just isn't that great for what I'm sometimes trying to do, but it's workable.The high-speed shutter takes smaller MP photos, usually less than one MP per picture or even just 300-500 Kb, but they're still not bad (read: not too grainy).I'd buy one again, but would look into the Sony's as they seem to have stepped up quite a bit in the waterproof/tough dept...Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: olympus stinks!
Reviews.Author: annoyed photographer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus Stylus Tough 8000 12 mp camera in Aug. of 2009. I went to use is this spring and an error message told me to close door before using in water. I couldn't clear the message nor could I use the camera!  I brought it to Best Buy and they in turn sent it to Olympus for repair. I have now been told that the camera can not be fixed because Olympus doesn't have the part!!!$300 for a camera that was used for 19 months before it broke. Olympus can keep their crappy products!!!

Reviews.Title: Really expensive disposable camera
Reviews.Author: Maya Azul Collins "Mayitaazul"
Reviews.Content: This is me second Olympus Stylus Tough camera. The first lasted 6 trips under water before the seal broke, this on lasted 5.Once the seal is broken the camera is dead and has to be replaced. The camera works fine on land and has some great features and takes very good pictures. But since I bought this to use underwater the fact that it does not last is a big problem. This camera is still under warrantee, but I will not be getting a new one. My friend has a Cannon that has lasted for over a year with many trips under water, so I think I will get one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: tough!
Reviews.Author: Lorrienbaby
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  Handles our hiking trips, rodeo trips and new baby...all while taking nice pictues that are very clear even when enlarged.

Reviews.Title: Quality?? Deffinetly NOT!!
Reviews.Author: Triathlete
Reviews.Content: Im a real person and just like many who purchased this camera and wrote a review I expected to sacrifice quality for INDESTRUCTIBILITY.... It did well for exactly 14months... Just after the warranty ran out I was cleaning the camera and notice that ALL the RUBBER SEALS were showing substantial signs of DETERIORATION!!!... are you kidding me!!  I am a bit of a neurotic person about things I spend 500.00 for so the camera has been cleaned after every use(only 3 times) washed as instructed and stored in a cool dry place... My top dresser drawer.  When customer service was called I was coolly informed that annual maintenance was required to keep the camera in working condition(30.00 a yr + hassle factor + shipping)... I was LIVID.  I cannot believe that after spending 500.00 on a camera Olympus wants me to send it to them every yr on MY dime to have it serviced so it will work as THEY advertised... I am VERY DISPLEASED and want all who are considering this camera to know UP FRONT the costs and HASSLE of ownership... AT LEAST 30.00 PLUS SHIPPING AND HANDLING EVERY SINGLE YEAR... until you buy a competitors camera that was well designed...

Reviews.Title: Photo Fiends Look Here
Reviews.Author: J. Spang
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. That's the only way to say it. I have over 30,000 pictures on my facebook, and I take photos very seriously. This does the job quite efficiently. So comming from an expert, if your in the market for a camera, get this one. I like the out doors, concerts, I've dropped it a thousand times and it still works like a charm. I took it to PC for spring break and it was a trooper, a little scratches and what not on the outside but the screen is intact and those are just battle wounds. I <3 this camera more than anything. You'd be a fool not to buy it, unless your getting the next version which comes in more colors and takes 3D video...sweet!

Reviews.Title: Pretty design, but fails where it counts.
Reviews.Author: Etched in Pixels
Reviews.Content: Aside from the slow focus, slow startup, and slow shot-to-shot performance (memory card writing and processing), this thing has some daft interface mistakes. Olympus, let me focus on the tap control, to tell you that if I disable it in the menus, then that should very well mean that it is DISABLED.  Instead, the camera will still respond to taps, asking you each time if you want to turn them back on.  Plus, there are several scene modes in which tap is automatically enabled.How inane.

Reviews.Title: worked great for 6 montsh
Reviews.Author: Grant
Reviews.Content: This camera was great for about 6 months. I am pretty hard on my cameras so I bought this TOUGH camera.  It worked great on my camping, snowboarding, and river rafting trips until I brought it to the ocean. My brother and I both have one and they both broke.  It may have been the salt water and not being able to rinse it off afterwards but both broke on our trip.  Although I really enjoyed it until then I will not buy it again as it did break after only 6 months. The underwater pics were great and the regular shots were just OK.  It was pretty user friendly as well.  Overall I gave it a 3 because it did not last long, but if you are not as tough on cameras as I am it would be a good buy. I would recommend it to my parents or people who go camping and skiing but not as often as I did.

Reviews.Title: keep looking
Reviews.Author: Uncle Charlie
Reviews.Content: If you got to this review, after all the others, I am pretty sure you are still unsure.  Keep looking.  I purchased the camera after reading everyone else.  Pictures are ok, not fine quality, even at 12mp/fine setting.  Wear and tear feature is good, except in spite of what the ad says, this camera HATES cold weather.  I used to carry it in the car for those unexpected shots that are there, and gone- when you wish you had a camera.  One night left in the car with 38 degrees outside, and next morning the color computer goes crazy.  Moisture in the (waterproof?) camera, or something.  I think you should get a high quality travel camera and just put a tough case around it.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: RealityCheck "Tiger67"
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these camera's 11/2009 for Christmas....We are avid outdoors people traveling to Mexico in our dunebuggies enjoying the Baja 1000, snorkeling in the ocean waters of Hawaii, California etc..On our son's vacation to Hawaii 12/2010 just one year after we purchased the camera it FROZE.The following week after a very tragic sequence of events in our life our camera would not turn on, NOTHING.We sent the camera's to Olympus and to get the 90 days warranty and repair we have to again fork out $136.40 each...just shy of a year ago we paid $297.50 for each camera.We have always had Olympus camera's and are very disappointed by the lack of durablity that comes so highly adverstised with these cameras. Think again before you purchase this camera. We have made a pact this will be the only repair we will pay for...after that totally different camera brand as Olympus has gravely failed in the product durability and longevity department!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Kevin P. Baker
Reviews.Content: Purchased in November 2009 specifically for a trip to the Galapagos islands as an underwater supplement our Nikon land cameras. It performed flawlessly during our Galapagos trip for snorkeling and as a quick point and shoot.  In August 2010 we took it to Hawaii for a summer snorkeling trip.  It worked well for the first two days then, as others have reported the sight of air bubbles seeping out from the casing.  We only ever snorkel to depths of a few feet-- nothing even close to the 30 feet this unit is rated for.  The sight of bubbles can only mean one thing... water was getting in.  Water got into the lens compartment making the pictures unfocused and blurry, although the camera still functioned otherwise normally.  But no more underwater pictures for the rest of the vacation.We took the camera back to our dealer who sent the unit back to Olympus for "repairs"  the unit came back 4 weeks later functioning again.  Now in December 2010 we are back in Hawaii for more snorkeling.  The seals were checked meticulously prior to going into the water today, but alas as soon as I tried to snap the first photo of the day the camera would not switch on and a combination of red and blue lights were seen in the ready LED indicator.  Immediately exited the ocean and went back to the condo.  After dryuing the outside of the unit I opend it up to find water in the battery and memory card compartment.  The unit is dead.  Once again snorkeling in Hawaii without a camera.At this point the camera is out of warranty, and is probably only fit for electronic recycle.  Don't waste your money on this or other Olympus "waterproof" camera.

Reviews.Title: Almost a 5 except it's heavier than I'd like it to
Reviews.Author: xoj168
Reviews.Content: it's a tad heavy, but for all the features it's not that big of a problem. Love my camera and it's got amazing options for different photos. There's even a feature for taking pictures of cuisine and documents, also snow and of course underwater! Overall awesome camera

Reviews.Title: Excellent, durable camera
Reviews.Author: R. Roper
Reviews.Content: Given to my son as a gift, he reports that the camera is super. The picture quality is amazing. He is planning to use it on a cruise to the Caribbean and while snorkeling, since it's waterproof to more than 30 ft.

Reviews.Title: Portable and Durable
Reviews.Author: bob c.
Reviews.Content: While the picture quality falls short of DSLRs, the Olympus Tough series cameras offer portablity, durability and ease of use at a very attractive price.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable camera, terrible customer care
Reviews.Author: Mr. D. Mullin
Reviews.Content: I bought the Olympus Tough Mju 8000 before going on a once-in-a-lifetime trip to Colombia for the same reason as most, I hoped it would be reliable and durable. It turned out to be nothing but problems from day one.Problems with camera:After following all the instructions for charging it prior to first use, I only managed a dozen or so photos before it died. I decided to be patient and thought that I was rewarded when it worked much better after the next charge. I should say here that I was very happy with the quality of the photos and the easy user interface. It is also a beautiful camera to look at. Unfortunately, It starting dying after fewer and fewer photos once I arrived in Colombia and eventually I could only get 2 or 3 snaps per charge. I have never dropped or bumped it and it's never been out in the rain, never mind under water. I had the camera approx 1 month before it became unusable.Problems with customer care:I thought that it may be a battery issue and I was willing to show the camera and Olympus the benefit of the doubt. However, the customer care has been terrible. I was not offered any recompense for P&P; to return it to them and they have had it over a month without any notification of when it will be returned repaired.I recommend you do not buy this camera as it has proven time and time again (read other reviews) unreliable and Olympus' customer care is appalling.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Zoiee
Reviews.Content: You may be able to splash this camera without breaking it but it is definitely NOT waterproof. Water goes into the camera!!!Bought this camera to Miami and it broke and I was left without a camera for 3 of the 6 days! So disappointing!Would not recommend this camera to anyone! Would never purchase an Olympus again either.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Michael G. Redmond "harley mike"
Reviews.Content: tough camera lousy picture, I returned it due to picture quality. I wish i had read the reviews before ordering this.

Reviews.Title: Happily Surprised by the Quality
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our honeymoon as an alternative to my husband's Nikon D300, as we were cruising and doing shore excursions that included rafting and beach stops. It is certainly waterproof and drop-resistant, taking nice shots of the reef and fish while snorkeling, and bouncing right back when I didn't have the strap on and it slipped once... maybe twice. On the ship and in the ports where we took both cameras, the point-and-shoot competed very well with the serious camera, delivering sharp shots faster when left on auto mode, and reliable effects when a mode was chosen. The videos we took in air (literally, while para-sailing) were decent for souvenirs, and the underwater videos are great novelties, though not nearly as good as the photos. The microphone was surprisingly sensitive. We took care to rinse after each water use. Battery life is quite good even through many flash shots on one charge. We have since kept it on-hand for every trip short or long - its speed lets us catch great shots on a whim. We would absolutely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: not that impressed..sitting in a drawer somewhere
Reviews.Author: sabrina west
Reviews.Content: bought this camera to take on bicycle trips..I thought it would be a good tough camera I never really found out because the quality of the pics where not that great I did not like the color so I went back to a canon and got a Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP ...I still have the Olympus but it is in a drawer somewhere and the bad thing besides just wasting my $$ on the camera was I bought the memory card which cannot be used on any of my other cameras and some of the accessories to go with it...I did like the accessories too bad they won't fit on my canon

Reviews.Title: wet or dry It's very good
Reviews.Author: simtek
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these olympus cameras.  I'm not a professional photographer or anything, I just need a bulletproof camera I can use on vacation and while snorkeling.  These work great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jojogirl777
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos. Took with me on a cruise.  With the photo card installed i was able to take nearly 700 pictures. Everyone who viewed my pictures thought they were great. You need to make sure you have the back up battery if you are going to take any video. Because of its  durability I have taken it everywhere - kayaking, ziplining, hiking in the rain which allows the ability to catch great memories.

Reviews.Title: The camera is great but takes poor low-light photos
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I've taken this camera snowboarding at over 12,000 feet in Breckenridge CO and snorkeling in Hawaii and I've never had an issue.  The camera performs well outdoors and in places other cameras would never go.  I've added a float strap and left it floating in a pool while it was passed around for great family photos.  The panoramic feature works great and is easy to master.  My only complaint about the camera is the indoor or low-light performance.  Once it steps up the ISO the photos get very grainy very quickly.  I would suggest forcing the flash on when you're indoors for better results but otherwise I've been very happy.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good...
Reviews.Author: GF "GLF"
Reviews.Content: This worked well up to 30 feet.  I did not try to go beyond that with this camera.  The only problem I had is that I left the camera on so I could snap a picture right away if I saw something that interested me and the fully charged battery ran out before the dive was complete.  Too bad the battery would not last through at least the duration of a dive so you could change the battery between dives and not miss anything.  Other than that, it is good for most shallow dives.

Reviews.Title: stylus8000
Reviews.Author: Chris Lammerts
Reviews.Content: picture quality is not as good as you would think for 12mp.  I tried it the other night in firework mode and it was VERY slow and I missed what I was taking the picture of

Reviews.Title: tough camera
Reviews.Author: dawn rubin
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a rough and ready teenager. Holds up to the high eneergy pressure of outdoor activities.

Reviews.Title: Tough 8000 Camera
Reviews.Author: RonM "RonM"
Reviews.Content: This Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 MP Digital Camera includes an optional 4GB chip and provides a plethora of features including video and waterproofness that make it hard to beat.  I bought it as a used product and it has served superbly since I turned it on for the first time.  I haven't tried the underwater video yet, but will soon, and am sure it will perform as well as it has with all its other features.  Olympus has maintained its reputation as being a premier camera provider with this product...it has been a welcome and well used addition to my camera inventory.

Reviews.Title: Sea Hunt for the Masses! Dive with Stylus!
Reviews.Author: D M Pax "Kahuna"
Reviews.Content: Bought this Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 MP Digital Camera, as a BD Gift for my GF, and if you have been following my Reviews here, you will notice that I have her Spoiled Rotten already, with so many Amazon Goodies! Read On ... my GF is a Scuba Master (PADI/DAN-certfied) and we have been looking for a Light-weight Digital (not 35mm) Camera that would suit her needs, when she is cavorting with the Dolphins, Whales, Manta Rays & Turtles.The PRIMARY feature was that it had to be Water Proof & Shock Proof, be able to take BOTH Underwater & Landscapes, so I reviewed many articles & Consumer reviews on DP Reviews,Cnet, & Amazon. ONE thing that I have to say that I did learn right away was to drop the camera into a Pool for 5-minutes, then went down took some Sample photo's and then Check it carefully for any leaksand/or condensation. This model was completely Sealed, did not and has not, noticed any problems, whatsoever, since early July 2009.TWO - I ordered the Olympus PT 045 Marine Polycarbonate case (not available anymore thru Amazon), at the same time. This Case IS A MUST GET ITEM for this camera, especially when Diving close to or beyond 1 ATM (33ft), and I cannot Say This More Clearly, it's a No-Brainer! My GF has Dived many times to 124 ft with this Olympus, and the Case is Completely Water-Proof.Whether, you are a Sports or Commercial Diver, you SHOULD have purchased this item already; it has completely prevented any Water or Shock problems!* EZ to operate, is Intuitive, with a rich Feature & Setting Controls, on-the-fly.* SHOCK-PROOF (6.6ft.) - Rugged metal body & shock-absorbing construction designed to withstand a 6.6-foot drop. Slipped out of her BC and dropped once on Pavement, with NO Damages!* WATER-PROOF (33ft.) - System of waterproof seals & gaskets keeps out water,  as deep as 33 feet (1atm) underwater. Extended to at least 150 ft with Case!* FREEZE-PROOF (14°F/-10°C) - winterized to perform at below-freezing temperatures. Not applicable to Hawaii!* CRUSH-PROOF (220lbf.) - a rugged body + reinforced LCD, withstands up to 220 pounds of pressure. Not planning on running my SUV over it, anytime soon, just so I can Whine later!* DUAL IMAGE STABILIZATION -  Sensor-Shift Image Stabilization compensates for camera shake to keep your shots steady while Digital Image Stabilization captures crisp, clear images. She just loves this feature!** Overall - Seems like every week passes that I get nothing but Kudo's and not just from my GF, but her girlfriends & Family as well. Everyone has been completely Impressed by this Olympus, and some have already purchased their own, in different colors, and including the TOUGH 6000 models, as well.Myself, I'm a Nikon Czar for many years, but I have to say that Olympus has produced a definite competitor model here, and has made Open-water Diving in Hawaii, a Great and rewarding experience, time after time. Again, I would Strongly Urge that anyone contemplating a Diving Trip, to purchase the Marine case, for so many good reasons.

Reviews.Title: waterproof tough camera
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Sargent "bookworm"
Reviews.Content: I Had borrowed my daughter's Stylus Tough and knew it was for me.  I already knew the picture quality was great and I liked how sturdy it was.  I looked at few others online but knew I was happy with the Stylus so why confuse the issue???  It is user friendly which I like.

Reviews.Title: Exelent Buy!!
Reviews.Author: Armando Cano Espinoza "elknof1"
Reviews.Content: Not only beautiful device, It does everything it is supposed, I-ve been diving up to 25 ft with no case and the pictures are clear, nice and the way it is supposed to be, the construction is really nice, its really tough. If you are looking for a waterproof comercial digital camera (obviosly is not comparable with some proffesional waterproof cameras) this one is by far the best, the only thing is that if you want to take it to the water, just get sure tha usb and batt/xd cover are well secured.

Reviews.Title: good camera, awesome functionality
Reviews.Author: D. Ohano
Reviews.Content: This is a cool camera! I think it not only stands up against the best point and shoot digital cameras around, but the fact that you can submerge it makes it a must for ameture photographers that want to do it all! Imagine taking video under water!We took this camera to hawaii and shot video of a pod of dolphins swimming under the boat!! Note; not a full length video as the memory card can only handle short bursts, but still pretty cool! Great camera for snorkeling! I have a professional SLR that I wish could do this!It's still new so I can't speak for its long term durability, but I can say that it's built like a tank--much tougher than a traditional camera. I did see the web post where there was water that got into the moniter screen on the back and looked like a perminate finger print smudge but so far I have not had any issues with mine.We had the latest Sony and just gave it to my sister in law because we got this one. Good buy!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera,But
Reviews.Author: Louis J. Gombkoto "Louie"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great but first time ( 2 weeks old) in the water I found that it was not water proof I am sure that the two door were closed and the seals were clean. I never went below 9 feet. It ended up with water inside. I have since then sent it back. We will see how they handle the warranty on this.

Reviews.Title: Really enjoy this camera
Reviews.Author: D. Bissetsmith "Camera Lover"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got this for a vacation she took to the sunny south.Pros:- Takes great pictures- I love all the different modes- Works well in dim light- Light and easy to carry- Nice looking camera (I chose to silver)- Company has a no hassle replacement guarantee!Cons:- 1st camera wasn't waterproof. Sucked the ocean water right in. And this was just swimming, not snorkelling or diving. The company replaced camera without a hassle- Haven't tried the replacement under water ... I'm thinking that perhaps it's really water resistant, not water proof.I think I'll get the waterproof case for the camera ...

Reviews.Title: Great rugged point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: J. Russell Kinsey "J{"
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews about the picture quality, but so far this camera has taken good pictures with a minimum of talent, which in my opinion has always been the hallmark the Olympus Stylus line back to their 35mm cameras.The flash is bright enough to take good pictures in a dark restaurant, but seemed to take a while to charge between photos.  Night portraits are somewhat washed out, but I've always had this problem.  The included Beauty mode can even out those colors a little at the expense of resolution.My wife and I recently took the camera on our yearly snowshoeing trip, and there is no comparison the the photos taken previously.  The tap function was especially convenient, as it allowed me to adjust the Macro setting and show others our on-screen photos without taking off my gloves to get to the controls.  It's far slimmer than our previous camera and can be slipped into the pocket of a pair of jeans.I found the menus to be well laid-out and intuitive.  I would recommend playing with the tap mode at home to develop a little muscle memory.  It was the only thing about the camera that I thought had a learning curve.  Only time will tell if it's waterproof.  We bought it to take with us on outdoor adventures, so we don't really plan on using it underwater.Overall, I couldn't be happier with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. The pictures come out great and there are so many options to choose from. I was able to play in the snow with my two year old and take pictures without worrying about getting the camera wet and breaking. The only thing I don't like about it is that sometimes when you try to take a picture it doesn't take the picture. Also inside the flash seems to make things too bright if its not on the right setting. Overall I would buy the camera again if something happened to mine. My favorite camera (and I've gone through a few...)

Reviews.Title: As advertised - Very satisfied!!!
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: I bought and used this camera for our trip down to the BVI. I wanted a single camera that would be waterproof and constructed well enough to withstand being bumped around. I took over 200 pictures with it, both underwater and above water. I was very satisfied with how it functioned. I was very careful with the door seals and never experienced any problems from snorkeling in the ocean with it. I did rinse it in fresh water as advised but basically it bumped around in my pocket for most of the trip. The pictures it took were very acceptable and indeed better than the pictures I took with the Nikon Cool Pix (which is the camera it replaced). The only complaint I had was it took awhile to get used to the menus in the camera. It was strange fiddling with a digital camera underwater though. Just loved the convenience of a single camera and the underwater pictures were much better than those I took with a underwater film camera. The only complaint I really had was when you bring it out of the water many times there were water droplets on the lens which showed in the above water picture.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Tough has many features
Reviews.Author: Scarlett O'Hara
Reviews.Content: This camera has more features tham more expensive cameras.  It is easy to carry and the quality of pictures and video are excellent.  The silver buttons on the back of the silver camera are a little hard to read, but otherwise a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera..
Reviews.Author: Eve Tycenski "ETycens"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 6 months now, it's been in all weather conditions, and it still works perfectly!  There are many different settings for all lighting environments, including the underwater setting which takes GREAT PHOTOS.  No water has gotten in, and it doesn't even have a scratch on it (and I've dropped it many times already).  Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Stylus 8000 Tough
Reviews.Author: Randy A. Gilman
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, I have a Digital SLR but this one is compact conveient and takes great pictures. The video isn't much to write home about but it is ok.  anyway if you want to take video, buy a video camera. Also, if you plan on using it under water word to the wise GET the neoprene cover its worth the [...] bucks and will save you on scratches and water damage... I learned the hard way, thats what I get for being cheap.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's meant to
Reviews.Author: M. Conley "gadget guy"
Reviews.Content: I will leave the extensive assessment to others. This is my third Olympus Stylus Tough camera -- my first was an older model, and my second is at the bottom of the Connecticut River (darn!). I use it while kayaking, skiing and snorkeling. Some people have commented that this camera does not take the BEST quality photos, but they are missing the point. It takes very good photos where you'd never bring another camera. When I snorkle I dive down as far as I can manage -- 12, maybe 15 feet -- when I kayak the camera gets banged around, and when I ski I don't worry about the camera. When I get home, I can adjust the picture quality on my computer if needed. I have tons of wonderful photos I'd otherwise miss out on.On a recent trip to the Caribbean I had the camera in the water every day. At night I'd rinse off the salt as per Oly's instructions. The last day the camera died -- when I opened the battery compartment there was a bit of seawater inside. The memory card was fine, though. When I got home I sent the camera, still under warranty, to Olympus. 2 days later, UPS delivered a brand new camera from Olympus -- no questions, no argument. Every now and then a defective product gets past quality control, so it's nice to know Olympus completely stands behind their product.I am very happy with this camera and would recommend it without hesitation. Be sure to put it through its paces while still under warranty, and you'll be happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Leaked
Reviews.Author: A. Singh
Reviews.Content: This is my third olypmpus waterproff camera - two stylus SW - 1030 and this one. Each leaked. I spent time making sure seals at battery and at data port dry and sealed each time before use since I am careful with my cameras but to no avail. I will neve buy olympus again. Three cameras in two years is just not right.

Reviews.Title: Really BAD pictures in low light conditions
Reviews.Author: Manuel Cordero
Reviews.Content: This is the third Olympus waterproof that I own, and for sure is the worst camera I've had. The picture quality is worse than any other camera.It's really good built but worthless as a camera. I'm really disappointed with Olympus and this is going to be the last time I'll buy a Olympus camera.

Reviews.Title: Tough 8000
Reviews.Author: Engine643
Reviews.Content: Like this camera so far. No complaints as of yet but am still getting used to the many features.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera. If you do get a leak ...
Reviews.Author: Editron
Reviews.Content: Very rugged. Takes great photos. I've had it for 2 years and have used it in pools and the ocean.I did have a moisture leak at the beach during the middle of vacation. I think it was caused by sand that prevented the seals from sealing. I found water inside the battery compartment AND inside the data port area. The camera continued to take photos, but the video screen blacked out, so I couldn't tell if it was working or not.I used a tip from a friend to fix it. Besides the obvious drying off the components gingerly, I bought a couple of pounds of uncooked rice and a big tupperware-type container. I opened the camera doors and put it in the rice and sealed it all up. In theory, the rice sucks the moisture out. I had been told to give it 3 days, but I only waited 1 day to test -- and it worked good as new afterward. I took more care to remove all of the little bits of sand from the seals and use the camera in the ocean 2 more days without any problems.The weakest aspect of this camera is the video recording. The videos come out a bit dark, grainy and jumpy, and the audio is terrible. But considering everything else this camera does so well, I can't take off any stars for that.I bought the black camera, but after 2 years of rugged use, the black decal has completely disappeared. So now my camera is a super-shiny silver. I could probably use it as a signal device if I ever get lost at sea.

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: I took the camera on vacation and captured some great shots, even the underwater shots. I think it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: T. Chipo "Secondchance"
Reviews.Content: The Olympus Stylus Tough 8000 is truly amazing....so amazing I bought two of them one for me and one for my best friend

Reviews.Title: Olympus Tough 8000 Is very durable
Reviews.Author: Cade Klock
Reviews.Content: The Olympus Tough 8000 is the most sturdy, durable, waterproof and impressive sport 12MP camera I have used.It takes fantastic underwater pictures and video.I definitely recommend this camera.The price was amazing (~$300).Shipping was extremely fast.

Reviews.Title: AWEOME CAMERA!!!!!
Reviews.Author: NinjaMan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I knew I was going to Costa Rica to freedive/snorkel and I am very pleased with it.  I never had to worry about it at all.  I was definitely down 30+ ft. a few times with no problems.  I just slipped it into my wetsuit through the neck opening and forgot it was there until I saw something worth shooting.  The pictures/videos came out great and I can't wait til my next trip to Marathon Key, Florida to use it again.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone who wants quality underwater photos/videos.  Here is a youtube link for the videos I took underwater in Costa Rica. After you click on one you can click on see more videos to see the rest. Enjoy![...]P.S.  If you wanna see some pics send me an email and I'll send you some.  [...]

Reviews.Title: Awesome Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: James D. Hayes
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for my honeymoon back in June. We went to Fiji, and I wanted to have something to take underwater shots of the coral, etc.This little thing did better than expected. The instructions suggest that you keep it underwater for no more than 10 minutes. We went on a 45 minute dive, and it held up. I did get a little nervous when after about 35 minutes underwater, I began to notice some 'bubbles' forming under the screen. I don't know if it was air, or if water got it, but when I got to the surface I opened everything up to dry out, and it disappeared soon.The pictures and video underwater turned out fantastic.I've dropped it a couple times, and generally used it like it's made to be used, and it's held touhg for over 5 months. So, definitely worth it if you're going to abuse it and want something to hold up underwater!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Pics
Reviews.Author: Jerrie R. Anthony "Jerrie Anthony"
Reviews.Content: We used this on our trip to the Cayman islands, it took amazing pictures underwater and on dry land-definitely lives up to it's description!  GREAT camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Lives Up To It's Name
Reviews.Author: Sunny "Sunshine Maui"
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous jumping in the ocean the first time with my new camera but a dozen times in the water and NO PROBLEMS.  The underwater picture quality was a treat after years of trying to use disposable underwater cameras- it was FUN to take pictures and videos underwater.  This camera has many, many menu settings and I was a little nervous that I would change a setting inadvertently but so far, I am finding my way around the menus and features without any problems.  The manual is a bit confusing, as are all camera instruction manuals that I have ever had.I wish it had a viewfinder, it only has a display screen.So far I have taken about 500+ pictures and find this camera fun and somewhat intuitive to figure out having had an Olympus Stylus before this one.  The computer software takes some figuring out- I am still working on that part.

Reviews.Title: A great tough underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Jolene M. Carter "aseyeseeit"
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed this camera. I have had it for about 6 months. It is very easy to use. Even for me. It is my first digital camera. The underwater feature is what brought me to digital. I had it in my purse and the back door accidently came opened and broke off. I sent it back under warranty and had it back repaired at no cost within 10 days.GREAT TURN-AROUND! Another time I dropped the camera and cracked a hairline crack in the back door. I decided the gasket was still holding well and chose to go snorkling with it. Bad decision. The camera died. Once again I sent it for repair under warranty and had it back within 10 days. This time they sent full instructions on underwater use and care. By the way, all the photos I had taken were saved. Even the ones under water. All were very clear. I have never had any bubbles or fog residue in my underwater photos. As for the back door problem... I purchased a silicone cover for my camera. It wraps aroun the back door and keeps it from opening. It also provides a cushion against drops for a klutz like me. I have actually accidently slung my camera across the sidewalk (with a few bounces). No harm done. Maybe a couple of scratches. I should have bought the silicone camera cover sooner. By the way. It takes excellent photos! Great video, also.

Reviews.Title: Unique cable / still my goto camera
Reviews.Author: Michael K. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: The camera takes very good pictures. It is tough I asked a guy sitting in front of us at Yankee Stadium to take our picture, he did, he dropped the camera as he handed it back to me. The camera was set on tap mode so when it hit the ground it also took his picture. The camera was none the worse for wear. The only issue I have with this camera is the uniqueness of the connector cable. I have at least a half dozen cables for my other devices which are all interchangeable. But the Olympus requires a different cable. It is now January 2014 and when I only have space for one camera this is the one.

Reviews.Title: tough
Reviews.Author: ktlm "k"
Reviews.Content: this camera is great for people who bring their camera everywhere. i can bring it to the beach, scuba diving, in the rain, and i've dropped it. it adjusts better to low light situations than other point and shoots i've had. i bought a protective sheet for the screen which seems to work pretty well. some friends have bought this camera after seeing mine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active lives!
Reviews.Author: Darlene Ginsburg "Darsi"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husbands birthday & anniversary gift, we got it 2 days before leaving for Mexico, we had no problems figuring out how to use the camera, we took it on all our vacation excursions, it was perfect for an active vacation!  We took underwater photos, photos in the rain & on the windy beach.  The picture quality is great.  My daughter has had the model under this one for a couple of years and still loves it, for us it's worth a little extra money to have peace of mind while traveling that if we drop it or get caught in the rain we don't have to worry about a broken device!  And we love the option of using the camera underwater, we took pics in a underwater caves!

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect!
Reviews.Author: Arthur J. Perschino
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Everything I thought it would be. Great value for the money. Quick and courteous service.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 8000
Reviews.Author: Jackrabbit
Reviews.Content: Noticed a few very small drops in the charging well, wiped out easily with a kleenex.  Followed product insert and rinsed well between used.  Camera performed very well.  However, notice some pictures in the water looked like had "rain spots" on them, maybe bubbles on the lens? It wasn't on all pictures.  Still playing with the settings, trying to optimize pictures.  For 12 MP, could be clearer in the water and out of the water.  At this point, I certainly would buy the camera again.  I highly recommend buying the floating strap.

Reviews.Title: Tough 8000
Reviews.Author: Clarey C. Prim
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for a trip to Mexico in Nov.  So far good camera with the tests have put it thru, including water test and college football game.  Good pics.  Found at a good price.  I like the extra settings for snow, water, night; a lot of features in a little camera.  Will really give it a workout in Nov. when in Mexico; planning on snuba diving, deep sea fishing, Chichen Itza, and snorkeling.  I also liked that it came with a microSD Olympus adapter, good call Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Better than the tough-6000
Reviews.Author: Mark Woods
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I use it in my watersports business and I destroyed the Tough- 6000 in 3 weeks. This one is tougher and has lasted the whole summer.

Reviews.Title: olympus stylus 8000 tough
Reviews.Author: joe dirt "valiant8163"
Reviews.Content: I bought the 8000 for my fishing trip to ALASKA and it exceeded my expectations....I'm a camera novice but by the end of the trip the 8000 worked like a champ and handled whatever mother nature could dish out where as my buddies had to put there cameras and video cameras away because of the weather...we would have lost alot for great photos and videos if not for the 8000....the panoramic feature was great and so easy to use.....I will say that you suffer on long distance close ups like the Bald Eagles i tried to take a pic of,the digital zoom is just to fuzzy...other than that no problems...havent tried it underwater yet but if your a active outdoors person look into this camera.... I had bought 1 for my son in the COAST GUARD and his buddies liked it so much they all got one.....

Reviews.Title: water proof BUT...
Reviews.Author: V. Calvin Hoe
Reviews.Content: I bought three to try out, Olympus, Panasonic and Nikon,  The Olympus had two CON: the lens cover and different sized memory card.  The Panasonic was the one I choose for our group.What kills other digital cameras in the field is the dust.  The lens cover started to not completely open after a week.  Sent back to Olympus and they fixed.  Happened again in two days so Olymous instructed seller to refund.Pictures are great for my use.The use of the different memory card was another CON.  We have a bout 20 SD cards that we recycle.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: D. Moore "dave_n_kc"
Reviews.Content: We bought the Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 for a whitewater rafting trip that we took in Colorado this Summer.  So far, no complaints at all.  Picture quality is fine and the camera is compact enough to carry anywhere.  It's a great companion to our D-SLR.  I look forward to my next scuba trip to test the camera underwater!The transaction was superb as I experienced quick delivery & excellent communication from the seller!

Reviews.Title: Olympus stylus keep getting better
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I owned the Stylus 770SW which is the first generation of these cameras that are in the 33ft class. That camera was a tank as I treated it very rough and it keeped on trucking, had 7.1 mega pix. and took amazing underwater photos. A friend had the second gen. 1030sw and the only real inprovement was the 10.1 mega pix. and some minor changes. When this 3rd gen. Tough-8000 came out I had the chance to check it out at best buy but didn't want to pay there high price so I purchased it through amazon. Here are some major improvements that are worth getting this bulldozer.Pros:1. Was a big pet peeve of mine when I viewed photos on the 770sw LSD and all the display info would cover up most of the photo for like 3 seconds till it fully displayed the photo. On the 8000 that is not a problem anymore as all you do is hit the display button as you view a photo and there are now 4 different info displays to view a photo, my favorite being no info and just the plain photo.2.Glare from the sun while I took underwater photos was a big problem with the 770 and 90% of the time I could not view what I was taking a picture of and just guess shooting. I don't know what they did but now I can see the LCD under water as if I was on land, big plus...3. Tap control is a new and fun feature that makes this camera that much user friendly. Really like how you tap it anywhere on the right side to view photos and left to go back, I have tapped it pretty fast and it keeps up.4. Size does matter and they made the 8000 a little bit bigger than the other models as it feels more comfortable.Cons:Only real con I have is when I pick one of the 19 scenes it offers and want to use digital or fine zoom I have to go into the menu and set it, once I turn the camera off or go to the play menu to view my photo I have to repeat this process all over again. Other than that there is no other under water camera for this price that can compete with the 8000.

Reviews.Title: Tough!!!
Reviews.Author: Allan Gonzalvo "Kimble7777"
Reviews.Content: It completely lives up to the name tough! I have dropped it on several ocasions and its still works properly. I have also put it in pools, rivers and most recently in the ocean and it lives up to its waterproof claim. Picture quality is pretty good too, underwater pics and vids are pretty darn good too.Overall i rate this product five stars and would recomend it to everyone specially if you have kids that are going to be using the cam because this is childproof.

Reviews.Title: Photo-phantastic!
Reviews.Author: Hugh Byrnes "hughbyrnes"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great piece of kit that is what it says it is, TOUGH. i have dropped it a few times and used it in swimming pool, the sea and at the base of a waterfall. brilliant functions and so many 'scene' settings to choose from. razor sharp images and the hand-shake control is a god send.I would reccommend a large capacity memory card such as 8GB mini SD card (adapter included in box) so you have plenty of room for many pictures at top resolution of 12MP.5 stars!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Angie Dawn
Reviews.Content: I have a digital SLR and wanted a hand held camera, we now have a toddler and with everything that must be carried we just didn't have enough space to always take the SLR.  We also wanted a tough camera because, well, we have a toddler.  This camera by far exceeded my expectations for a hand held.  You can adjust the ISO, white balance, and even do pixel mapping...granted it doesn't give as much user manipulation as the SLR but it's more than I expected.It has 19 automatic settings ie: Portrait, landscape, sport etc. (including 4 underwater settings), it has a better than average close up (even good with documentation photos), it allows you to set the depth (underwater) at which you are taking photos, it has a shadow reducer, image stabilizer, and even a beautifying option that softens the portrait after you take it.  I've taken many pictures in the pool and they are very good (better than disposable underwater cameras) but have yet to try it out in natural water (it's also ok to use in sea water).The down points in my opinion...  It has a tap function (where you can tap parts of the camera to take photos/manipulate the camera).  It is very difficult to learn and doesn't work all that well in my experience.  The problem is, it turns itself on very easily and you have to go to the menu to turn it off.  The dial that moves the settings from automatic, to video camera, to playback, etc moves very easily and can be moved accidently.  This happened to me quite a few times.  The camera is bump proof but definitely not scratch proof.  My toddler has dropped and tossed it a couple of times and it's survived wonderfully...but it's scratched like crazy.  The zoom isn't great...but to be able to survive the water it has to be encased...the camera is a 12 mp so it's not that big of a deal...just mentioning it.  Also the video camera just isn't all that great.  It doesn't allow you to zoom at all, it's a bit grainy in low light, and you only have the choice to set it as underwater or dry.In my opinion these aren't deal breakers...just annoyances.  If you are looking for a great point and shoot, that can survive bumps and bruises and also works underwater (up to 33 ft) I definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a guy like me
Reviews.Author: Justin Clift
Reviews.Content: This camera is me-proof, I have go through 4 digital camera before I realized it was time to fork over the extra cash to get one that is destruction-proof. The beauty feature is pretty cool and makes great pics for facebook. 100% worth every dime!

Reviews.Title: olympus tough 8000
Reviews.Author: Kimvan Tran
Reviews.Content: I bought it for Hawaii trip. I like it so much for snorkeling pictures, but it's not fast enough for motion pictures.

Reviews.Title: Do not trust with your photos
Reviews.Author: Michael Yucha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my vacation to Hawaii.  I knew I was going to be doing a great deal of water activities and wanted to make sure I could capture all the fun and memories.The camera itself took quite nice photos, until it died after getting wet once.  I took the camera snorkeling at Molokini crater in Maui.  Since I was snorkeling the camera was only a few feet underwater, nowhere close to the 10m (33f) depth the camera is supposed to be able to be waterproof too.After one use, the camera lens got drops of water "trapped" behind it.  Which could clearly be seen in both the LCD and photos taken.  The back LCD also appears to have allowed water to seep in and to add final insult to injury, the unit stopped powering on shortly afterwards.I made sure to follow all instructions.  I even brought them with me on holiday, to ensure proper use of the camera.  Since this was a once in a lifetime vacation for me, I wanted to guarantee I'd have wonderful photos for years to come.Instead I had a $400 paperweight.  What's most upsetting are all the lost photos (memories).  I was unable to get photos of my kayaking, waterfall and snuba adventures (to name a few) later in the trip.  I am not sure if the unit I had was just defective or if their is a larger problem with these cameras in general.But really when it comes to your vacation or other special event do you really want to chance having a defective camera?  Please I urge you do not trust your treasured moments and photos to this camera, or Olympus.This camera was bought for the sole purpose of capturing all the fun memories of my holiday.  Instead it's now a constant reminder of all the lost photos (memories).I returned the camera to Olympus to be repaired (at a cost of $20).  I was sent an email shortly after sending the unit in for repair.  With an "offer" to swap the defective unit for a new (or refurb) model for an additional cost!?!  The unit died the first time it was used, and they want me to pay for another one?The camera was returned back to me, no paperwork was provided as to what caused the problem, and what (if anything) was done to fix the unit.  Right now the battery is charging and I pray it will power on.I wish I had never bought this camera.  I'm out $400 for the camera, and I don't have any photos from my vacation.

Reviews.Title: POOR CAMERA FOR WATER USE
Reviews.Author: ECU-NC Teacher
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera in April and intended the use to be beach and ocean trips. The camera has never been more than 4 feet below the surface, however it leaks. In less than 4 months, we've had to return the camera for repairs- leaks each time and the leaks lead to other problems. Olympus is not helpful in fixing the situation. If you call them, they act as if you are wasting their time or you are too stupid to figure out how things work. If you are looking for a water camera....get the SeaLife ones. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: I read the reviews, but was hopeful anyways
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: Boooo.  I read the reviews, but felt that statistically, the positive reviews outweighed the negative.  I can't believe that 12-megapixel photos can look so bad.  This camera takes awful photos.  I have a little 2 megapixel Sony that takes better photos.  I have a 'big dog' Nikon SLR, so I wanted a 'pocket' camera for the beach, the zoo, etc...  My cell phone takes better photos than this.I really should have believed what I read in the reviews... My bad.

Reviews.Title: I should Have Read the Reviews!
Reviews.Author: Electronics Geek "Jack"
Reviews.Content: So far, in a couple of test shots, the pictures are really awful.  Fuzzy focus, flat contrast.  Yeah, it looks really cool, probably submerges well and all but, clearly (or NOT so clearly), Olympus does not belong in the digital space.  They did so well in the 1990s with film point and shoot, lots of us thought it would translate well into digital. I'll try more over the weekend but it looks like this one is going back to Amazon.  Glad I kept the box.  As soon as Sony or Nikon decides to enter this market, it's all over for these also-rans.

Reviews.Title: Run, Duck, and Hide from this camera
Reviews.Author: A. D. Bernard
Reviews.Content: This is my second Olympus stylus touch camera.  After reading the manual inside out to ensure i care for my expensive camera properly. They both died within 3-6 mths of use.  So i have two expensive Olympus paper weights.So I'm never ever going to purchase another olympus product again because clearly they are selling a product that is not fit for the use intended.Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: AVL
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for a trip to Costa Rica because it is water"proof" to 33ft.  NOT TRUE!  It leaked after only two dives to only 15-20ft.  Now all the camera does is turn on.  I can take no pictures or use any of the functions.  I read the manual and made sure that nothing was interfering with the seals around the doors.  After spending $40 on two disposable cameras and getting other tourist to email photos to us, we do have pictures from our trip.  By the way Olympus sells a waterproof housing for the camera too.  But from what I can tell it only goes about the same depth.  So why do you need to make a housing for it?  Maybe because it's NOT WATERPROOF.  Sent it to Olympus for repairs.  I hope we get a camera that works when it comes back.CONS:NOT WATERPROOFPros:It was a great little camera till we put it in the water.  I suggest you use it only in a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark F. Mckee
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my girlfriend. She did not like her previous camera because it was too delicate and broke after the first week. She tends to drop electronics, frequently. So I bought this camera after reading reviews and talking to people at stores, I made an excellent purchase!We took this on vacation to the 1000 islands in NY. After 5 minutes of owning this camera she dropped it out of her purse, #1. Camera took it just fine. Later that week she was throwing it to someone else they missed the camera hit the cement, still works as it was out of the box. By the end of the vacation the camera had been dropped on cement or dirt at least 4-5 times and it works great.We also tested this camera in the St. Lawerence River. We were very sceptical since well it is not in our nature to put electronics in the water. We made sure to read the manual which we forgot to bring and downloaded one online instead. After we made sure the ports for the camera cord, battery compartment/memory card were definately closed into the river it went. We took many underwater pictures. The camera went down to about 5-8 feet and was just fine. Photos came out great and we couldn't be happier. We did not test the temperature aspect of this camera but did use the "tap" feature (by mistake). I will take this sking with me this winter and see how it fares.One tip I have is that if you are planning to take this underwater, get a flotation device. Either buy the one that is made for this camera or make your own. We had to take great care when switching the camera between users so that it did not see the bottom of the river.

Reviews.Title: Takes a beating but...
Reviews.Author: Todd Swenson
Reviews.Content: We dropped our other Sony point and shoot into the sand at the beach. That hurt. Completely destroyed but it took great pictures. So we wanted something durable. I think this has been pointed out that the image quality for this camera is lacking. It may have to do with our learning curve because its new but I did alot of tweeking on this thing and the image quality is just not that good. I find that it blows out the highlights and looks a bit grainy. But the main thing is that the sharpness on it is not all that sharp. That may be a personal thing though. I think we may have been better off buying another Sony (which we've had 2 and loved them both) and getting a warranty with it.

Reviews.Title: Not water proof
Reviews.Author: E. Balzer
Reviews.Content: This is the second Olympus UW camera that I have owned. The first was a stylus 770 which leaked salt water on a carribbean vacation. American Express replaced that one since the original warranty had run out. With the replacement money from AE, I bought another Olympus underwater camera...the Stylus Tough 8000. It also leaked the first time I went snorkling in the Carribbeam. I tried to get Olympus to refund our money versus fix it under warranty, but they refused. It is due back to me this week. That's two vacations in row that an Olympus camera has leaked resulting in no underwater pictures. I would never buy another Olympus camera EVER again. I will try this repaired one in a swimming pool or a lake first and if it leaks again I will just throw it away....even if it still is under warranty.

Reviews.Title: JUST STOPPED WORKING! TWICE!
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!I bought this camera about a year ago. The first one lasted me about 2 weeks before it just completely stopped working for no apparent reason. It says shockproof, and I didn't even drop it.Then, I brought it back to the store I purchased it from, and they gave me a brand new one. I used it for 1 day at the beach and again, it just stopped working. Disgusted, I threw it in my bag, and left it there for 2 days. When I took the camera out of the bag, the entire thing was completely corroded. Looks like it isn't as waterproof as it says it is. I didn't even take it in deep water just swimming in the ocean.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Kori S. Matherne "kmsm"
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Everything we thought it would be! Durable and indestructible. Takes great under water pics too!

Reviews.Title: I was skeptical but am pleasantly suprised...
Reviews.Author: A. Volk
Reviews.Content: This camera has it all!  I was really nervous to make such a big decision but am really happy with this camera.  It's a real gem!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Rocio Nacary Carrero Duran
Reviews.Content: Es muy buena la camara, aunque aun no la he podido utilizar bajo el agua, cuando la pruebe dare mi opinion,

Reviews.Title: Met expectations
Reviews.Author: SREsme "SingleDigit"
Reviews.Content: This camera has met its main requirement in my main reason for purchase, the waterproof part.  I took this camera to the pool with my kids and we had a blast taking underwater photos.  Of course the camera got dropped with the kids wanting to take turns taking pictures and it also fell to the bottom of the deep end which was only 9 feet I believe.  When in video mode, the volume isnt the greatest in replay but at least its there.All in all I only purchased this camera to take it to a waterpark and not being scared if the camera would get destroyed by water and it held its own.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Sylus Tough-8000
Reviews.Author: J. Keck
Reviews.Content: Did a very good job.  Took pictures in the ocean while snorkeling and had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT FOR A CRUISE VACATION
Reviews.Author: Clifford Mills
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect camera for any kind of vacation. I owned the SW770 and now this one. It's great for snorkling, scuba diving. I have dropped it a few times and it keeps on taking great pictures. I bought it because of the pretty much imperviousness of it. It can take the punishment. It has many options, you can see the image much better with this upgrade. The menu is easy to understand. It really is waterproof to 30 some feet. Takes video underwater. All around great camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: I have owned at least 5 digital cameras, this by far is the worst one.  I received it as a gift for my bd.  We canoe, ski, spend a lot of time outdoors, my husband thought it was perfect for me since my last camera had a dent in it (still worked, but I think he bought it because it was "tough").  Anyway, I'm sure it is "tough", but I don't care if I can drop it from 6 feet or take pictures with it getting wet or can take pictures in below freezing temperatures if the pictures it takes are all grainy.  What good is "tough" if the quality of pictures are terrible.  During the day the pictures aren't always bad, but every picture I have taken at night is always filled with noise.  I don't want to have a point and shoot that I have to stop and make adjustments to before I can take a picture.  I want to pull the camera out and have it take a good picture without a lot of fussing, hence a point and shoot.  Don't waste your money on this camera.  Go to the camera store and play with all manufacturers display models before you make a purchase to make sure you are comfortable with the menus and settings as well as happy with the quality of the pictures it takes.  Do your homework in the store.

Reviews.Title: Rockn camera
Reviews.Author: A. Wood
Reviews.Content: I'm so excited about my camera choice. It was a bit hefty on the price, but overall the camera is excellent. There are many features to use and edit pictures with. One should definitely read the manual cover to cover upon recieving... It will make you appreciate this beast of a camera that much more. As far as taking normal shots it does a great job. Part of my reasoning in choosing this camera was that it was water proof up to 33ft. I haven't gotten to test the underwater capabilities yet, but summer time is approaching. I did a lot of research on this camera before finally just accepting that it's probably one of the best hand held digitals on the market.

Reviews.Title: Poor Pictuer Quality and Don't Take it in the Water
Reviews.Author: Disappointed Swimmer
