Reviews.Content: I specifically purchased this camera for its claim to be water proof. Inside pictures not sharp but assumed I would be sacrificing this quality since the camera is suppose to be water proof to 33 feet. Was a bit worried about taking it in to the ocean on my vacation 6 mos later but since I paid $400 for this purpose, I went for it. First time in, no issues. Took it snorkeling only so was predominantly on the surface. Second time in, the camera leaked in a matter of minutes. Door were sealed but screen began doing crazy stuff and then went completely off. Got out of the water (salt water of course) and tried drying it out to no avail. Camera never powered back on. One of my travel mates has the same camera. Did better than mine but by the end of the 7 day trip, bubbles were coming from his camera and the screen started to fade out. When I went to return the camera to Best Buy, I was told that the warranty did not cover water damage!!! A water proof camera and the waranty doesn't cover water damage???? Since I did buy the extended coverage, they went ahead and sent the camera in for repairs rather than replacing it. Guaranteed I will not be buying another Olympus and I will not be buying my next camera from Best Buy. My friend bought his from Frys Electronics almsot a year ago and the camera was immediately replaced and that was w/o the purchase of an extended warranty!

Reviews.Title: Waterproof?  I think NOT!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My father purchased this camera for me for my birthday.  We went to Belize and we were going to scuba (my daughter's first dive) and I was going to stay at the 30 feet level to take pics of her.  Before giant striding into the water from the dive boat I checked all of the compartments to make sure they were closed.  They are spring loaded, so it's either open or closed, nothing in between...but I checked anyway.  I held the camera away from the compartments and off I went.  Came up and turned around to take the picture of my daughter.  NO way.  Compartment door on the side had opened and water in the camera.Not only did I have supposedly tough camera that could go underwater fail miserably, but no pictures for our photo album of "first dives" our family has.  It would have been better if I had bought a disposable underwater camera.  It, at least, would have survived in less than 1 foot of water.  Buyer Beware!  I will update after finding out what Olympus will do about this...

Reviews.Title: Very, very, very Good!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tattie Sena "Tattie"
Reviews.Content: Infelizmente roubaram a minha camera.Eu estava apaixonada por ela. O tamanho eh perfeito. As imagens das fotos belissimas! Tem varias opcoes de tipos de fotos. Pra quem nao entende, facilita muito na hora de usar. Recomendo muito! Quero outra igual!!!!

Reviews.Title: Obsolete model
Reviews.Author: G. Blitz "Hiker biker"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get this camera for diving because if the underwater housing leaked at least this camera might survive..Canon does not have a housing for their underwater camera so that made my choice for me.I searched everywhere for the PT-045 housing and could not find one. Olympus told me that they only do a certain number of housings in their production run and this particular model is sold out.I tried the camera and found the operation quite simple, the only drawback was the position of the lens and my fingers sometimes covering part of the shot.I had to return the camera as without the underwater housing it is useless to me. Although Olympus wouldn't say so there must be a new model just around the corner so I will get that one when it comes out...if I can get a housing!

Reviews.Title: OK, But Audio is Terrible
Reviews.Author: M. Lee "austxmax"
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this camera, and with Olympus in general.  OK, the camera itself is a nice little package.  However, the audio on the videos was terrible (and that is being polite).  I actually had to yell at the camera to get it to register my voice at all.  Completely unusable.  I also tried several other Olympus 'Tough' models, and they are all the same.  I know this is not a video camera, but Olympus does tout the feature, so it should be at lest usable.  I called Olympus Tech Support and they told me they'd never heard of this issue.  I told them they should read Amazon's reviews soemtime.  I also emailed Olympus (I really did want to keep the camera).  They were supposed to answer within 48 hours.  4 days later I finally received a response that...the audio is not adjustable.  I have returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: S.J.
Reviews.Content: We tried every single function, as well as its resistance and we must say that, so far, it has been better than we initially expected. This product is an A+.

Reviews.Title: Exelente Producto
Reviews.Author: J. CHARLIES
Reviews.Content: Es una muy buena cámara, la calidad de imagen es buena, claro hay que configurarla bien para que de buenas imagenes.  La probé en el mar y me dió buenos resultados. Estoy muy contento con esta cámara.  Lo único tal vez es que el altímetro no es my presiso.  El Profundímetro sí. Y no he podido tadavía uzar bien el tap control.  Pero a parte de eso es una exelente cámara. Se la recomiendo a las personas aventureras que quieran una cámara a prueba de todo.

Reviews.Title: A little disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Blue "Angel"
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera, but to recharge the battery you have to insert inside the camera not pratical at all, because it was a very expensive camera, if you have an extra battery you will have to buy a separate charger or wait forever for both batteries to charge...I am really disappointed with Olympus, how could this company be so cheap...This is my second Olympus camera, I have the Stylus 1050 and they included a separate charger with it, I guess this will be the last time I buy a Olympus camera...

Reviews.Title: Delivery
Reviews.Author: M. W. "M.W."
Reviews.Content: The shipping of this item brought it to my door step days before I expected it

Reviews.Title: n/c
Reviews.Author: Robert Holden "quail springs"
Reviews.Content: i didn't get in the day you said i'd get it.so my scuba diving trip to Auswas with out the camera, so i haven't used it yet while diving

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus Tough=8000
Reviews.Author: J. White "tour guide"
Reviews.Content: Item was returned because the buttons were too small for me to operate, start-up was too slow, and the image stabilization was inferior to other products.Olympus Stylus Tough-8000 12 MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: How fast is the 8000?
Reviews.Author: DONALD A. MILLER "mindskater"
Reviews.Content: I am about to order the Olympus S. 8000, my first non-Canon product in ten years.  I think "tough" is what my gift to my wife should be.  What I want to know (and could not find at the Olympus site or here) is the frames per second.  My Canon DSLR is 12mp(megapixels) and gets 3 1/2 frames per second and is superb.  My 1mp and 5mp rangefinders are slow, like 1 frame per second which is useless for action shots.  And I find that anything greater than 4 mps is overkill as I print usually 4X6s or E-mail.  You can't e-mail anything larger than 2mp to most servers.  So, how fast is it?  And read the 1 star review with a leaky lens; I assume it was an exception and he got a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: V. DONNICI
Reviews.Content: watercoldhotpressureshockGood image quality and functionalities!
